results.definition: cease to operate or cause to cease operating
examples: The owners decided to move and to close the factory
My business closes every night at 8 P.M.

results.definition: come to a close
examples: The concert closed with a nocturne by Chopin

results.definition: not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances
of textiles
marked by fidelity to an original
fill or stop up
examples: Can you close the cracks with caulking?

results.definition: inclined to secrecy or reticence about divulging information
examples: although they knew her whereabouts her friends kept close about it

results.definition: near in time or place or relationship
examples: don't get too close to the fire

results.definition: move so that an opening or passage is obstructed; make shut
in an attentive manner
examples: he remained close on his guard

results.definition: lacking fresh air
the last section of a communication
the temporal end; the concluding time
examples: they were playing better at the close of the season

results.definition: come together, as if in an embrace
examples: Her arms closed around her long lost relative

results.definition: the concluding part of any performance
become closed
examples: The windows closed with a loud bang

results.definition: crowded
unite or bring into contact or bring together the edges of
giving or spending with reluctance
examples: very close (or near) with his money

results.definition: (of a contest or contestants) evenly matched
fitting closely but comfortably
at or within a short distance in space or time or having elements near each other
examples: how close are we to town?

results.definition: bar access to
examples: Due to the accident, the road had to be closed for several hours

results.definition: be priced or listed when trading stops
examples: The stock market closed high this Friday
My new stocks closed at $59 last night

results.definition: bring together all the elements or parts of
cause a window or an application to disappear on a computer desktop
change one's body stance so that the forward shoulder and foot are closer to the intended point of impact
close in relevance or relationship
examples: we are all...in close sympathy with...

results.definition: complete a business deal, negotiation, or an agreement
examples: We closed on the house on Friday
They closed the deal on the building

results.definition: confined to specific persons
draw near
examples: The probe closed with the space station

results.definition: engage at close quarters
finish a game in baseball by protecting a lead
examples: The relief pitcher closed with two runs in the second inning

results.definition: finish or terminate (meetings, speeches, etc.)
examples: The meeting was closed with a charge by the chairman of the board

results.definition: rigorously attentive; strict and thorough
examples: kept a close watch on expenditures

results.definition: strictly confined or guarded
used of hair or haircuts
